meanings.definition: To contort the face or body in a grimace or expression of pain.
meanings.sent1: She would squinch her face whenever she tasted something sour.
meanings.sent2: He squinches his eyes shut tightly when he's scared.
meanings.sent3: The clown tried to squinch his nose comically, but it just looked strange.
meanings.sent4: The weightlifter squinched his muscles as he lifted the heavy barbell.
meanings.sent5: The child squinched her whole body in anticipation of the injection.

meanings.definition: A small arch, corbel, or other structure built across the interior angle between two walls to support a superimposed weight.
meanings.sent1: The ancient building had beautiful squinches supporting its upper floors.
meanings.sent2: The architect included decorative squinches in the design of the cathedral.
meanings.sent3: The tiny mouse made a cozy nest in the corner of the squinch.
meanings.sent4: The intricate squinch added elegance to the room's architecture.
meanings.sent5: The painter captured the play of light on the ornate squinch in his artwork.
